Title: Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Causal Inference & Measurement (m/f/d)
Description:
Join our team of data science and causal inference experts to shape next-generation pricing strategies and measure the causal impact of our initiatives. We employ state-of-the-art causal inference methods to understand and optimize pricing decisions for millions of customers. Our work not only drives efficient revenue management processes but also ensures that our strategies are grounded in robust, scientifically-valid findings.



YOUR ROLE AT SIXT


You design and build tools to measure the impact of pricing strategies using causal methods.
You apply techniques like A/B testing, difference-in-differences, and double machine learning to support business decisions.
You create and improve experiments to test pricing and marketing strategies in a structured way.
You develop and maintain tools that help estimate causal effects and work well in production systems.
You work with product managers, engineers, and data scientists to turn ideas into working solutions.
You stay up to date with research in causal inference and help guide and support less experienced team members.





YOUR SKILLS MATTER


You have several years of experience in data science, especially working with causal inference and pricing or marketing data.
You have used causal methods to measure the effects of pricing strategies and revenue systems.
You are skilled in statistical analysis and familiar with methods like double machine learning, causal graphs, and propensity score matching.
You understand how to use tools like instrumental variables and synthetic controls to estimate effects in real-world data.
You have applied difference-in-differences and regression discontinuity designs to measure changes over time.
You can explain technical ideas clearly and work well with others to turn analysis into action.





WHAT WE OFFER


Generous Time Off Enjoy 28 days of vacation, an additional day off for your birthday, and 1 volunteer day per year
Work-Life Balance & Flexibility Benefit from a hybrid working model, flexible working hours, and no dress code
Great Employee Benefits Access discounts on SIXT rent, share, ride, and SIXT+, along with partner discounts
Training & Development Participate in training programs, external conferences, and internal dev & tech talks designed for your personal growth and development
Health & Well-being Private health insurance to support your well-being
Additional Perks Enjoy the Coverflex advantage system to enhance your employee experience





About us:

We are a globally leading mobility service provider with a revenue of ‚Ç¨4.00 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (taxi, ride, and chauffeur services), and SIXT+ (car subscription), giving our customers access to our fleet of 350,000 vehicles, the services of 4,000 cooperation partners, and around 5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,000 rental stations. At SIXT, top-tier customer experience and outstanding customer service are our highest priorities. We believe in true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Get started with us and apply now!
Show more

Title: Internship for Biotech Students
Description:
AI/ML Engineering Intern (Biotech Transition)

Location: Fully Remote (Legal Residence in Portugal Required)

Duration: 3-Month Internship

Build the Next Generation of AI Products with TensorOps

TensorOps is an applied machine learning studio helping organizations worldwide plan, design, train, and deploy production-grade ML systems. We believe that diverse backgrounds strengthen our team and are excited to offer an internship for students from the life sciences who are passionate about transitioning into software and AI. This is a unique opportunity to leverage your analytical skills from biotechnology and apply them to cutting-edge machine learning challenges.

What We‚Äôre Working On


Generative AI applications: Chatbots and Agents
Traditional Machine Learning: Time Series Forecasting, AdTech, Computer Vision, etc.
MLOps: Improving ML pipelines at scale


Core Stack You'll Learn

As we work with many clients, our stack varies, but you will gain exposure to:


Python APIs: FastAPI
Containerization: Docker, Kubernetes
Model Training & Serving: LightGBM, CatBoost, PyTorch, HuggingFace
Data Engineering: Pandas, Polars
LLM Frameworks: LangChain, LangGraph
Observability: MLFlow, Langfuse
Cloud Platforms: AWS, GCP


The Internship Role

We‚Äôre looking for an AI/ML Engineering Intern to join us for a 3-month intensive program. This role is specifically designed for students with a background in biotechnology or related fields who want to build a new career in tech. You‚Äôll report to and be mentored by a senior team member, working on real projects that make a tangible impact from day one. Our goal is to provide you with the foundational skills for a successful career in machine learning.

Who We're Looking For


Background: Currently pursuing or recently completed a BSc or MSc in Biotechnology, Bioengineering, or a related life sciences field.
Passion: A demonstrable passion for software development and AI, perhaps through personal projects, online courses, or self-study.
Programming Skills: Basic to intermediate knowledge of Python.
Fundamentals: A foundational understanding of programming concepts (e.g., data structures, object-oriented principles).
Curiosity: An eagerness to learn about LLM system design (RAG, agents) and ML system design (pipelines, training/inference).
Communication: Excellent English communication skills.


Why TensorOps?


Career Transition: A dedicated pathway from biotech into the world of AI.
Real-World Impact: Work on real-world projects, benefit from rapid feedback loops, and see your measurable impact.
Mentorship: Learn from experienced engineers who have shipped ML systems at scale.
Growth Path: This internship is a direct pipeline to a full-time role. Exceptional interns will be considered for a Junior Machine Learning Engineer position (‚Ç¨25,000-‚Ç¨40,000 annual salary) upon successful completion of the program.


Compensation & Perks


Internship Salary: ‚Ç¨15,000-‚Ç¨20,000 (annual, prorated for the 3-month duration).
Full-Time Potential: A clear path to a full-time engineering role with a salary of ‚Ç¨25,000-‚Ç¨40,000.
Benefits: Travel expenses allowance and an Urban Sports Club membership.
Show more

Title: Lab Test Engineer (Hybrid or Remote in Portugal)
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 27,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.4 billion euros in 2024.

Job Description

We are looking for a Lab Test Engineer to join our team and support the maintenance and development of technical labs for online courses. This role is essential to ensure that labs are functional, user-friendly, and aligned with the latest product and service updates.

Your Responsibilities


Test course labs, including instructions, tools, and UI, ensuring they meet learning objectives
Fix issues reported by technical trainers and lab hosting partners
Execute lab steps as an end user, document technical issues, and update labs based on UI or service changes
Create new labs or lab steps when needed
Collaborate with content teams to resolve issues and identify areas for improvement


Qualifications


Minimum of 2 years of experience in technical areas (Azure Infrastructure, AI/Developer, Security, or AI Business Solutions)
Knowledge of GitHub (repo management and code maintenance) and Markdown
Experience working with virtual machines
Programming skills in Python and/or C#
Familiarity with Azure and AI services
Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills
Excellent written communication skills
Fluent in English


Additional Information


Workplace type: Hybrid or remote
This position is based in Portugal
Applicants must meet residency or eligibility criteria to work within the country (example: a residence permit or work visa)

Title: n8n Workflow Specialist
Description:
OUR HIRING PROCESS:


We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals‚Äîevery person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it‚Äôs decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live.


INFUSE is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy

Role Overview: Build and implement n8n workflows to accelerate our go-to-market operations. You'll work directly alongside our team to create automated solutions that drive efficiency and scale.

Key Responsibilities:


Build n8n workflows based on requirements and collaborative planning
Connect and integrate various APIs within n8n automations
Work with data transformations and create scalable, robust systems.
Collaborate on workflow architecture and implementation


Requirements:


Strong hands-on experience building complex n8n workflows
Proven ability to work with APIs and data integrations
Engineering background preferred
High technical aptitude
Self-starter mindset - able to execute independently with minimal guidance

Key Responsibilities:

  • Build n8n workflows based on requirements and collaborative planning

  • Work with data transformations and create scalable, robust systems.
  • Collaborate on workflow architecture and implementation

  • Proven ability to work with APIs and data integrations
  • Engineering background preferred
  • High technical aptitude
  • Self-starter mindset - able to execute independently with minimal guidance

Title: Frontend Developer (all Genders)
Description:
DEINE K√úNFTIGE ROLLE.

We are seeking a talented and experienced Mid-Senior Front-End Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in front-end development and be proficient in our tech stack, including React, TypeScript, Redux and Git. You will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining our front-end systems, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and efficient. Design, develop, and maintain front-end systems.


Design, develop, and maintain front-end systems using Spring and JavaScript.
Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
Implement and maintain code quality standards.
Participate in Agile development processes including SAFe.
Troubleshoot and debug applications to optimise performance.
Ensure the security and scalability of front-end systems.


WAS UNS ANTREIBT.

Dealing with your colleagues in a respectful way is important to you, as well as possessing a system of values. However, you are not lacking a good sense of humour to keep the team spirit up!


A Bachelor's or master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field
3+ years of proven experience as a Front-End Developer
Proficiency in React, TypeScript, and frontend technologies such as Redux, React Query, Saga, Jotai, Material UI, and Shadcn
Proficiency in React, TypeScript, Redux and Git in an agile environment
An understanding of UX/UI are highly appreciated
Git in an agile environment
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Portuguese on native language level (C1 or higher)
Proficient in English for business purposes, German is a beneficial addition but not essential
Based in the Greater Porto Area.


Our Main Technologies:

React, TypeScript, Redux and Git

EIN NORMALER TAG - UND DOCH SO BESONDERS.

Benefits we are happy to offer you:


Hybrid work model in Greater Porto area
30 vacation days per year: Extraordinary six weeks off per year
Meal allowance: pre-paid credit cards for all your meals
Private health insurance: Multicare3
Private accident insurance: Covers all accidents, business and private
Personalised onboarding program: Both in Lisbon and Munich HQ
Personalised training budget: For your professional growth


In our open and welcoming culture, your strengths are at the forefront. We believe that the best jobs are those where you can grow personally, are based on your unique skills, and bring you joy every day. With us, you enjoy the freedoms and dynamic atmosphere of a start-up company, while also benefiting from our deep expertise and a loyal customer base that has been steadily growing since 2002. Your creative freedom is important to us because we firmly believe it is the key to outstanding results.

√úber uns

Weiterdenken wo andere aufh√∂ren.

Gegr√ºndet im Jahr 2002 und mit Standorten in M√ºnchen und Lissabon, sind wir ein dynamisches Team mit rund 45 Mitarbeitenden. Unsere Expertise liegt in der Spezialisierung auf Standardsoftware, kombiniert mit branchenspezifischer Beratungskompetenz und automatisierten Prozessen. Unser klares Ziel ist es, die Krankenversicherer und Beihilfestellen zu st√§rken. Das erreichen wir durch die Bereitstellung einer umfassenden Palette standardisierter IT-Produkte, die dazu beitragen, Komplexit√§t mithilfe nahtloser Standards aufzul√∂sen. GLOBAL SIDE erleichtert die Zusammenarbeit, f√∂rdert Innovationen und liefert wertorientierte L√∂sungen. Unser Fokus liegt darauf, die Qualit√§t, Effizienz und Zug√§nglichkeit der Gesundheitsversorgung nachhaltig zu verbessern.

Title: KDB+ Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: KDB+ Developer

Seniority: Senior (5+ years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Lisbon. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


Bachelor's / master's degree in the area of information technologies, management, or similar areas;
5+ years of experience as a KDB+ Developer;
Strong understanding of tick-architecture and other patterns of kdb applications;
Knowledge of Agile methodologies;
Fluent in English, Portuguese is high valued;
Available to do a hybrid model in Lisbon (2x week)
Candidates outside of Portugal, or candidates without experience in KDB+, won't be considerated.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Data Scientist!




Requirements:

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field (MSc/PhD in Data Science is a plus)
Between 2 and 4 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or a similar role
Proven knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, NLP, and text dataset curation
Hands-on experience in coding for real-world data analytics applications
Experience in NLP tasks, such as Text Classification, NER, and Information Retrieval
Experience working with LLMs, OpenAI API (or equivalent), and RAG
Proficiency in Python and ML/DL packages (PyTorch, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, Pandas)
Solid mathematical foundations and experience in statistical consultancy
Strong business sense with the ability to quickly understand use cases
Familiarity with data engineering, modeling, and business analysis
Good communication skills
Experience with Cafe. Plus
Programming languages like Java, R and C++. Plus
Knowledge of cloud tools such as Azure, AWS, Google Cloud. Plus
Experience with MLOPs practices. Plus
Fluency in English and Portuguese.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/DataScientist".




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST - MID (HYBRID)
Description:
Portuguese company hires for hybrid work

Working Model: Hybrid

Location: Lisbon, Portugal (2/3 times per week in Client)

Language Requirements: Fluent Portuguese and English C1

Seniority: 5+ Years

Sector: Energy

Instructions: Please send your CVs in English and make sure to include all skills and experience that match the requirements of the opportunity. This will significantly increase your chances of success.

We‚Äôre looking for a forward-thinking Data Scientist to join our team and help drive innovation at the intersection of traditional analytics and cutting-edge Generative AI. This role is perfect for someone who thrives on building robust models, deploying intelligent systems, and seamlessly integrating GenAI into real-world workflows.

Key Deliverables


Development of medium-complexity analytical models (e.g., regression, classification, clustering, machine learning on structured data at rest).
Implementation of high-quality code in Python and/or R.
Design of models and applications that integrate Generative AI (LLMs, diffusion models, etc.) into practical use cases such as text generation, summarization, contextual classification, image creation, autonomous agents, or intelligent copilots.
End-to-end pipelines covering preprocessing, fine-tuning of base models (e.g., LLaMA, Mistral, T5), evaluation with metrics such as BLEU, ROUGE, and perplexity, and controlled deployment (e.g., via API), following best practices in ML engineering for GenAI.


Must-Have Qualifications / must be clearly listed on your CV:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Proven ability to work collaboratively in global, cross-functional teams.
Critical thinking skills with a strong focus on problem-solving.
Commitment to delivering high-quality outputs.
Proficiency in English (written and oral).
Experience with relational and NoSQL databases.
Hands-on experience in developing machine learning projects (Python, R, or SAS), deploying models into production, and managing the full model lifecycle.


Nice-to-Have Qualifications


Knowledge of the Energy & Utilities sector and GDPR compliance.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies, Jira, and Confluence.
Additional language skills: Portuguese, Spanish.
Experience designing interactive data visualization solutions for presenting complex analytical results.
Previous experience developing AI-driven analytical solutions (highly valued).


Top Skills


Python, R (SAS is a plus).
API-based model deployment.
Strong focus on code quality, reproducibility, and maintainability.
Expertise in regression, classification, clustering, and structured data handling.
Model lifecycle management (development ‚Üí deployment ‚Üí monitoring).
Integration of Generative AI (LLMs, diffusion models).
Preprocessing and fine-tuning base models (e.g., LLaMA, Mistral, T5).
Evaluation using BLEU, ROUGE, perplexity and other domain-specific metrics.
Workflow integration for advanced use cases: summarization, text/image generation, autonomous agents, intelligent copilots.
Strong knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues‚Äîat all levels‚Äîwill invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won‚Äôt find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a data scientist in McKinsey‚Äôs Financial Services Lab (FinLab) in Lisbon, you will apply advanced analytics techniques including predictive modelling, geospatial analysis, generative AI, optimization, and simulation to large-scale datasets at some of the world‚Äôs most influential institutions.

You will partner with client teams across project settings to drive and produce week-one analyses and enable quick-turn analytics client development work. Many of these analyses will be used to develop solutions and products to craft reusable data-driven insights.

You will become an advocate for the use of data and analytics, guiding teams on the proper selection of datasets and analytic strategies to ensure we increase the value of impact we deliver to our clients. This will enable collaboration across other practices, analytics groups, and technical teams to ensure efforts are synergistic and cutting-edge.

You will help to maintain and deliver a compelling portrayal of McKinsey‚Äôs data ecosystem and capabilities to clients and internal stakeholders. As well as drive awareness of the firm‚Äôs policies related to data risk and refine/operationalize KPIs.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or a related discipline
2+ years of professional experience in data science, data engineering, or a closely related field
Experience with data engineering practices including ETL pipelines, orchestration tools such as Airflow, and big data platforms like Databricks; hands-on experience with data modelling techniques (e.g., 3NF, data vault, etc.), ability to work with both structured and unstructured data
Strong applied data science skills with experience in supervised and unsupervised learning, time series forecasting, clustering, optimization, geospatial modeling, and generative AI; familiarity with libraries such as scikit-learn, XGBoost, LightGBM, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, and pandas
Solid engineering capabilities in Python and JavaScript, with hands-on experience building and operationalizing solutions using FastAPI and React
Comfortable working with Git, CI/CD tools, and modern development workflows
Familiarity with Azure cloud services; experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and distributed computing frameworks is a plus
Highly inquisitive and creative problem-solver with a passion for turning data into actionable insight
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical topics to both technical and non-technical audiences
Entrepreneurial and self-starting mindset, comfortable navigating ambiguity in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Collaborative, professional, and team-oriented, with a strong sense of ownership and service

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Richemont owns some of the world‚Äôs leading luxury goods Maisons, with strengths in jewellery, fine watches & premium accessories, including Cartier, Van Cleef & Arpels, Montblanc, Vacheron Constantin, etc.

We are seeking for a talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science & AI team within the Group Data Office.

You‚Äôll be part of the team that is responsible for integrating artificial intelligence across our group, and you'll be directly involved in developing AI-powered solutions that are already impacting thousands of users daily.

If you're passionate about working in a fast-paced, innovative cloud environment and eager to make a real impact on the world of luxury, we encourage you to apply.

You Will Be Responsible For


Designing & developing complex ML&AI-driven approaches to solve business problems , including natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, time series analysis, recommendation systems, etc.
Leveraging Generative AI to build innovative multimodal RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems and Agentic AI solutions.
Gathering requirements and effectively communicating developed solution to the business.
Exploring new AI techniques and technologies to drive innovation across Richemont.
Partnering with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Analytics Engineers & IT to deliver solutions.


If You Have


Master's or PhD degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related Engineering discipline.
2+ years of experience in Data Science & Machine Learning, with a proven track record of developing and deploying machine learning models.
2+ years of professional experience in Python programming language and data-related libraries.
Professional experience in Google Cloud Platform or other cloud platforms, including experience with cloud-based machine learning services.
Autonomy, proactive & curious with a strong sense of ownership.
English mandatory.
Bonus if you‚Äôre experienced in Google Vertex AI and Git.

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team in Porto. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and Python development to deliver insights that drive smarter business decisions and innovative solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy data-driven models and machine learning solutions.
Perform data exploration, cleaning, and feature engineering to support predictive and analytical models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, business) to define data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Develop scalable data pipelines and contribute to the improvement of existing data infrastructure.
Visualize and communicate complex data findings in a clear and compelling way.
Apply best practices in model validation, testing, and monitoring.




Requirements

5+ years of experience in Data Science or a related field.
Strong proficiency in Python and its data ecosystem (Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Plotly, Power BI, or similar).
Solid understanding of statistical methods, machine learning techniques, and model evaluation.
Familiarity with SQL and data management.
Ability to work in a hybrid model (1x per week on-site in Porto).
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate data insights into business recommendations.




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Familiarity with MLOps practices and deployment of models into production.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

üöÄ We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU! ‚ú®

üí° @ KCS IT, we seek those who stand out üåü, those who always strive to be better üí™ and fight for it üèÜ. We value individuals who share our core principles:

At KCS IT, we champion equality and embrace diversity üåçüåà. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all!

‚ùå We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

üì© All applications with relevant skills are welcome! üöÄ

We are looking for an Amazing: Machine learning developer

Seniority: Junior

Type of position: Hybrid

The amazing you, will have:

3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a related role.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Understanding of software engineering principles and Design Patterns.
Hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience with Airflow or other workflow orchestration tools.
Familiarity with GCP tools for data and ML workflows.
Experience working with LLMs and modern NLP techniques.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

Knowledge of MLOps practices and CI/CD for ML.
Familiarity with TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face frameworks.
Experience with monitoring ML models in production.
Exposure to data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, or similar).




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

  • Experience working with LLMs and modern NLP techniques.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Knowledge of MLOps practices and CI/CD for ML.
  • Familiarity with TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face frameworks.
  • Experience with monitoring ML models in production.
  • Exposure to data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, or similar).


Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster

  • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
  • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: AI Engineer - 100% Remote
Description:
Its not magic. Its artificial intelligence. And you could be the next wizard.

You know that moment when everything clicks and you realize youre ready for something bigger? This is that moment.

Position: AI Engineer (100% remote in Portugal)

So, what does it mean to be an AI Engineer here?

It means being at the forefront of innovation, turning real-world challenges into smart solutions. It means working with deep learning, NLP, computer vision, chatbots, and agentic AI platforms to reinvent how our clients operate.

What youll be doing (in epic fashion):


Develop AI solutions that actually work not just in theory, but in the real world.
Work with deep learning, NLP, TensorFlow, computer vision, chatbots, and agentic platforms.
Take part in multidisciplinary projects, from functional design to prototyping and testing.
Document solutions, share learnings, and contribute to our AI strategy.
Collaborate with internal teams to identify innovation opportunities using AI.



What you bring to the table:

Mandatory:


Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience in AI solutions.
Strong command of Machine Learning, Deep Learning, TensorFlow, NLP, and related areas.
Solid understanding of algorithms, object-oriented design, and functional principles.
Experience in developing REST APIs, and designing NoSQL and relational databases.
English fluency is mandatory.



Valued:


Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Experience with innovation accelerators.
Familiarity with cloud environments.



Why work with us:


Challenging projects with direct impact on our clients.
A collaborative, curious team with a spirit of innovation.
Hybrid and flexible work environment.
Competitive salary and benefits tailored to your needs.
Real opportunities for growth and development.



Were not looking for someone perfect. Were looking for someone real.

If youre an AI Engineer ready to be part of something thats changing the game, we want to talk to you.

Apply now and join the digital revolution.

Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


3+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role.
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business.

The Customer AI & Rapid Prototyping department stands at the forefront of digital transformation at TUI, driving company-wide AI adoption. Our team develops innovative AI solutions and personalized customer experiences that create measurable business value and give TUI a competitive edge in the travel industry. We combine data science, AI prototyping, and strategic implementation to deliver both rapid innovation and sustainable personalization solutions. In our dynamic work environment, we foster a culture of experimentation and data-driven decision-making, while working closely with various business units to shape the future of personalized travel experiences.

We are looking for a talented and dedicated Machine Learning Engineer to help leverage AI and advanced analytics to better understand our customers, deliver personalized experiences, and drive business growth through data-driven decision-making

Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!

About Our Offer


Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.



About The Job


As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of a cross-functional team that enables AI engineering skills and capabilities across TUI Group, aligning with TUI‚Äôs AI strategy. Being an AI enthusiast with a strong DevSecOps mindset, you‚Äôll collaborate with your team to deliver solutions that challenge the status quo, taking full responsibility for your AI solutions from design to operation. You diligently care about the quality of your work, including proper documentation and security aspects.
You will collaborate closely with our App, Web, and CRM teams to leverage AI and advanced analytics to better understand customer behavior, deliver personalized experiences, and support business growth. You‚Äôll build and maintain segmentation models that enable tailored offers and informed decision-making. Your work will contribute to seamless, engaging customer interactions that drive satisfaction and bookings, ensuring customers feel understood and valued.
You can articulate your thoughts and ideas and take the initiative to translate them into outcomes, ensuring alignment with business and technical teams together with the domain‚Äôs teams and the Group Enabler teams, you will research, evaluate, and test new approaches, processes, and tools, helping teams use them effectively. You will participate in Communities of Practice and collaborate on shared initiatives to grow your experience. You are eager to learn and grow in your role, welcoming support and coaching from senior colleagues.
You thrive in an international, multi-cultural team, constructively challenging and holding high expectations for yourself and others.
You consistently drive for technical excellence, ownership, and self-organization at both team and personal levels. You are passionate about learning, acquiring new skills, and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in your focus areas.
Security is part of everyone‚Äôs job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.



About You


Experience in designing, implementing, deploying and using various AI models and algorithms.
Experience in deploying AI solutions (e.g. CI/CD pipeline, API development, containers).
Strong programming skills in Python.
Understanding of machine learning/AI frameworks and libraries.
Hands-on experience with cloud technologies and services (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Experience with SQL and/or Snowflake.
Some experience with Generative AI technologies (e.g. Bedrock, Langchain, LangGraph).
Familiarity with RAG and Graphs.
Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature and/or prompt engineering.
Customer-focused engineer with a passion for crafting high-quality digital products, continuous improvement, and effective team collaboration.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with an understanding of the social, legal, and ethical impact of AI technologies.



From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.

We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

Title: AI Developer
Description:
You'll be focused in


Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into AI/ML solutions
Designing, developing and deploying AI models and algorithms for tasks such as classification, regression, clustering, and recommendation
Preprocess and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful features and insights for model training
Experiment with different machine learning techniques and algorithms to improve model performance and accuracy
Implement and optimize AI/ML models for scalability, efficiency, and real-time inference
Conducting rigorous testing and validation of AI models to ensure robustness, reliability, and generalization
Staying updated on the latest advancements in AI/ML research, frameworks, and tools, and evaluate their applicability to our projects


In order to succeed, you‚Äôll need


Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
Proven experience working as a AI Developer or related role
Hands-on experience in building and deploying AI models and generative AI models in production environments
Experience in programming languages commonly used in AI/ML development, such as Python
Strong experience in machine learning algorithms, techniques, and frameworks, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn
Experience with cloud platforms and related AI/ML services including generative AI technologies
Strong communication and analytical skills
Great English skills, both written and spoken


About The Product

Our Production Spoke is committed to delivering value through data in the production and logistics domain.

We focus on enabling the spoke in the design, implementation, and operationalization of impactful use cases by leveraging AI technologies.

Company Benefits


1200‚Ç¨ to equip your home office
720‚Ç¨ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)


Cool Things You‚Äôll Experience In Our Work Environment


Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding


About VW Group Digital Solutions [Portugal]

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Group Digital Solutions [Portugal] we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! üöó

Title: Principal Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps
Description:
We are looking for a Principal Machine Learning Engineer focused on ML Ops and ML Platform development. This engineer will join a centralised Machine Learning Engineering team, supporting scalable AI systems across Digital and Retail use cases.

The ideal candidates will bring hands-on expertise in MLOps, distributed Machine Learning platforms, and experience working in cloud-native environments, especially Azure

Requirements


8+ years of relevant experience in Machine Learning, Data Engineering, or MLOps roles.
Proven track record of building, deploying, and maintaining ML systems in production environments.
Proficient with ML frameworks: PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Scikit-learn
Hands-on experience with MLflow, SageMaker, and Azure ML for model training, tracking, and deployment
Skilled in CI/CD pipelines for ML using GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, and Terraform
Expertise in model observability, monitoring and drift detection
Experience building and managing ML pipelines using Airflow, Azure Data Factory, and related tools
Cloud infrastructure expertise with Azure (primary) and AWS (secondary).
Containerization and orchestration using Docker and Kubernetes (AKS).


Benefits

The Things We Really Care About:


Health Insurance, because health comes first
Flexible working hours
Open holidays, take the time you need for yourself
Profit distribution for everyone
Mindera Annual Trip, Sports, and sharing groups to connect and have fun!
Training & conferences, create your own training plan
Child Care vouchers


Other good things:


Choose Laptop & Peripherals that best suit your needs
Hotspot with unlimited usage (PT), for work or Netflix ;)
We have amazing offices in Porto, Aveiro, and Coimbra if you want to physically connect with minders. Remote from Portugal is also an option. Remote from other Countries will depend on your current location and Projects
At the offices, we have a wide range of snacks to keep you fed and healthy
Partnerships with local businesses


Most of all you get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together in a politics-free environment. Our culture reflects our lean and self-organization attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication. Freedom and Responsibility go hand in hand, and we value commitment, feedback, and empathy.

About Mindera

At Mindera we use technology to build products we are proud of, with people we love.

Software Engineering Applications, including Web and Mobile, are at the core of what we do at Mindera.

We partner with our clients, to understand their products and deliver high-performance, resilient, and scalable software systems that create an impact on their users and businesses across the world.

You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together.

Our culture reflects our lean and self-management attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication.

We are proud of our work and we love to learn all and everything while navigating through an Agile, Lean and collaborative environment.

Check out our Blog and our Handbook!

Our offices are located: Porto, Portugal | Aveiro, Portugal | Coimbra, Portugal | Leicester, UK | San Diego, USA | San Francisco, USA | Chennai, India | Bengaluru, India | Cluj-Napoca, Romania | Blumenau, Brazil

Title: MLOps Engineer (Python) Remote, Europe
Description:
Svitla Systems Inc. is looking for an MLOps Engineer (Python) for a full-time position (40 hours per week) in Europe. Our client is a broker platform that provides brokers with real-time risk capacity, anytime, anywhere. It represents a genuine step change from the current manual and time-consuming process available on the market, providing an unprecedented level of service to brokers and clients. It is a first-of-its-kind digital model that claims to deliver a unique advantage to its business partners. It is the first fully digital and automatically driven Lloyd‚Äôs of London syndicate.We‚Äôre looking for a Consultant MLOps Engineer with strong software engineering fundamentals and practical knowledge of MLOps tooling and practices.

You'll join the Property Squad, which focuses on developing data-driven tools to streamline insurance quoting, enhance user experience, and improve the profitability and scalability of property portfolios.This is a hands-on engineering role, best suited for a strong Python and Kotlin developer with an interest in MLOps infrastructure and workflows.

Tech Stack & Environment


Languages: Python (must-have), Kotlin
Cloud: GCP
Containerization & Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes
MLOps Tooling: MLflow, Kubeflow, SageMaker, Airflow
Monitoring: Grafana, Prometheus, Tableau
Search/Analytics: Elasticsearch, Kibana
Version Control & CI/CD: GitHub, Dekster


Requirements


5+ years of experience in software engineering with a strong MLOps focus.
Deep knowledge of Python and hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes.
Proven experience building CI/CD pipelines for ML model deployment.
Practical experience with MLFlow and other model lifecycle tooling.
Strong understanding of ETL, especially around Feature Store management.
Familiarity with geospatial systems and indexing (e.g., H3).
Experience in integrating ML models into production environments.
Strong problem-solving, coaching, and collaboration skills.
Comfortable working in a distributed, asynchronous environment.
Education and Knowledge
Experience working in Agile environments (Scrum/Kanban).
Familiar with tools like Jira for workflow management.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.


Nice to Have


Familiarity with Kotlin or Java.
Background in insurance, fintech, or other regulated domains.
Prior exposure to model monitoring and governance best practices.
Responsibilities
Model Deployment & Maintenance:
Build and manage CI/CD pipelines for Asset and Policy RAM models.
Package models using MLflow, containerize them, and maintain runtime diagnostics.
Feature Store ETL:
Maintain and extend connectors (AIR ingestion, Pub/Sub integration, asset-level features).
Claims Matching Pipeline:
Automate ingestion of LLM-extracted claims and align with exposure records.
Geospatial Data Systems:
Implement and extend systems using H3 indexing and open geospatial datasets.
Monitoring & Observability:
Build and manage alerting systems, troubleshoot production issues, and support Data Scientists.
Infrastructure Support & Tech Debt:
Improve server stability, evolve RAM architecture, and support updated model deployment.
MLOps Coaching:
Coach team members on Kedro, MLflow, model testing, and production best practices.
Cross-Squad Collaboration:
Liaise with the Model Ops (MOPs) team, resolve Feature Store delays, and manage infra-level dependencies.


We offer


US and EU projects based on advanced technologies.
Competitive compensation based on skills and experience.
Regular performance appraisals to support your growth.
Flexibility in workspace, either remote or our welcoming office.
Bonuses for article writing, public talks, and other activities.
Generous time off, including vacation, national holidays, sick leaves, and family days.
Personalized learning programs tailored to your interests and skill development.
Free tech webinars and meetups organized by Svitla.
Regular corporate online activities.
Awesome team and a friendly, supportive community!


Olena Kurtieieva- Recruitment Researcher

Email: o.kurtieieva@svitla.com

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/olenakurtieieva/
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
CAPGEMINI ENGINEERING




At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.




YOUR ROLE




As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a key role in leveraging data to drive strategic decisions and optimize business outcomes.




Develop, validate, and deploy statistical and machine learning models to address business challenges such as demand forecasting, optimization, pricing, and customer behavior analysis.
Source, prepare, and analyze structured and unstructured datasets, ensuring data quality for modeling purposes.
Monitor and evaluate model performance, refining models through experimentation and iteration.
Communicate insights effectively through visualizations, reports, and presentations that support decision-making.
Contribute to the development of standards and best practices for data science workflows, including model evaluation and deployment.
Stay up to date with advancements in machine learning, statistics, and AI, and apply innovative techniques where relevant.




YOUR PROFILE




Minimum of 6 years of professional experience in advanced analytics, statistical modeling, or machine learning, including at least 3 years in a dedicated Data Scientist role.
Proficient in Python and its data science ecosystem (e.g., scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong foundation in mathematics, probability, and statistics.
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data science platforms and services (AWS preferred; GCP or Azure also valued).
Proven track record of working with complex, real-world datasets to deliver measurable business value (e.g., cost reduction, revenue growth, operational efficiency).
Experience working in Agile or cross-functional product teams.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.




WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE




Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Access valuable training and certifications in cutting-edge technologies.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.




Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Title: Quality Assurance Scientist
HTML:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_24

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Salary: The range is between ‚Ç¨1,751.27 and ‚Ç¨1,834.93, depending on the candidate's professional experience (1 year or more).

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOS is seeking a talented Quality Assurance Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Connected Things (Cyber-physical systems) Group, namely in Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs. It is expected that the candidate will contribute to the business area of Digital Health.

Your Role

  • Document and maintain software requirements;
  • Document, execute and maintain test cases based on requirements;
  • Develop and maintain UI tests;
  • Set up and maintain CI/CD pipelines.

Your Profile

  • Mandatory Requirements:
    • Academic Qualifications: Master's degree or equivalent academic qualification in Informatics, Bioengineering, and Computing Engineering or similar;
    • Professional Experience: Preferably 1 year of professional experience in the field.
  • Technical Skills:
    • Candidates should have experience in software engineering and testing. Experience in developing automated tests for mobile or web applications is highly regarded. The candidate will work in close contact with software development, so experience within this field will be highly valued.
  • Other Skills:
    • Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);
    • Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.
We Value

  • Experience with test case management tools, such as TestRail or similar;
  • Experience with CI/CD tools, such as Jenkins or similar;
  • Candidates experienced in automating tests of Flutter and/or Java (Spring Boot) applications using mocking tools such as Mockito or similar is highly valued;
  • Experience with Quality Management System maintenance or auditing, according to standards such as ISO 13485:2016 or ISO 9001:2015, is valued.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and hybrid work opportunities, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are open from the 5th to the 20th of August 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working on October 1st, 2025.

Applications Must Be Made To The Email And Contain

  • Curriculum Vitae ‚Äì mandatory;
  • Motivation Letter ‚Äì optional;
  • Recommendation Letters ‚Äì optional.

Selection Process

Admitted candidates will be subject to a curricular evaluation. Based on the results, the top-ranked candidates will be invited for an interview. All applicants will be notified of the results of the call via the email address provided in their application.

After notification, all candidates have 10 days to comment.

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

Title: Freelance Annotator (Portuguese) - AI Trainer
Description:
At Toloka, we connect smart, curious people from around the world with freelance online tasks that train and improve artificial intelligence.

What We Do

The Toloka Annotators connects individuals with Generative AI projects from leading tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the full potential of AI by involving real people from around the world in the development process.

About The Role

Annotation is what helps AI make sense of the world. As an annotator, you may be invited to take part in online projects such as rating AI-generated content, evaluating factual accuracy, or comparing responses - when projects are available.

Responsibilities:


Carefully review provided data (text, images, or videos)
Label or classify content based on project guidelines
Identify and flag factually incorrect, sensitive, inappropriate, or unclear material


Important note: This is project-based work. Tasks are available only when projects are active. You may be invited to one or more projects depending on your profile and current opportunities.

Requirements


Bachelor's degree in any discipline
Minimum 1 year of experience in any professional role
You have advanced proficiency in Portuguese and a C1 (or higher) level of English, both written and spoken
Logical thinking, fact-checking and reasoning abilities
Strong attention to detail and ability to understand and follow complex instructions
Strong communication skills, including the ability to ask clarifying questions when needed
Genuine interest in technology and artificial intelligence


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: AI Engineer (LLMs/GenAI)
Description:
Were a tech consulting boutique based in Lisbon, helping regulated and high-impact companies ship real AI into production. If you enjoy turning messy business problems into crisp AI products assistants, document intelligence, computer vision, smart automations this is for you.

What You'll Do


Partner with clients to spot high-value AI opportunities and frame problems with measurable ROI.
Design and ship end-to-end solutions: discovery prototyping evaluation hardening production monitoring.
Build with todays stack: LLMs, RAG pipelines, vector databases, prompt engineering, function/tool calling, evaluation frameworks, guardrails.
Own the engineering bits: APIs, data pipelines, CI/CD, observability, cost/perf tuning, and documentation of architecture & lessons learned.
Champion responsible AI practices: privacy-by-design, bias testing, reproducibility, and clear model/product telemetry.



You have


3+ years building ML/AI in production (mid to senior).
Strong Python or TypeScript; solid algorithms and software design (OO/functional).
Hands-on with ML/Deep Learning and NLP = Natural Language Processing (transformers/embeddings), plus experience with REST APIs, NoSQL and RDBMS.
Comfort with a major cloud (Azure/AWS/GCP) and containerization.
Bonus: RAG at scale, vector stores (Pinecone/pgvector/FAISS), LangChain/LlamaIndex, OpenAI/Azure OpenAI, Triton/ONNX, feature stores, MLflow, K8s, Databricks, Vertex/Azure ML.



Why Nimber


Build useful AI that ships: real users, real impact, real telemetry.
Small senior teams, low bureaucracy, high ownership.



The process


Quick intro chat 2) Technical working session (no gotchas, real use-case) 3) Culture/values chat 4) Offer.



Sound like your kind of challenge?

Send your CV and GitHub to geral@nimber.pt
Show more
