Title: Python Developer
Description:
Your responsibilities




We‚Äôre looking for a Python Developer (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust back-end services to join our team and contribute to the development of our web-based product: the AI-powered CELUS Engineering Platform, which automates the electronics engineering process and significantly reduces development time. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development and a commitment to seamless user experiences. In this role you will:




Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
Interact with a wide variety of tasks, from building APIs to coming up with clever business logic.
Interface and team up with other areas of engineering to solve diverse back-end problems, from third-party integrations to data modelling.




Your profile




3+ years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, preferably FastAPI, pydantic
Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB and SQL preferred
Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
Knowledge of micro-service architecture is highly advantageous but not essential
Fluent in written and spoken English
Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking
Fluent in written and spoken English




We offer:

Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.




Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.




Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.




Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.




Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, English/Portuguese language classes, trainings and workshops.




Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, ‚Äúworkation‚Äù program, 24 vacation days plus additional paid Christmas week holiday.




ABOUT US

CELUS simplifies and accelerates the electronics design process for the global engineering community with it‚Äôs AI-powered CELUS Design Platform.




We are a Munich founded start-up on a mission to unleash scalable engineering by providing a comprehensive library of electronics components and CUBOs, automating all the manual and tedious tasks in the design process, so engineers can spend more time on innovation.




Join our community of tech enthusiasts and proactive high performers in an amazing journey through the world of electronics. We work with a clear vision, empowered by an ambitious, fast-paced environment and caring atmosphere, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued. We have offices in Munich, Germany; and Porto, Portugal; and Austin, Texas, USA.




Embracing diversity is a very important value at CELUS. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist (Generative AI Focus)

Permanent, Fully remote within Portugal




A permanent opportunity is open for a Senior Data Scientist to join a forward-thinking AI team, leading the development and deployment of machine learning models ‚Äî with a growing emphasis on Generative AI.




Key Responsibilities

Translate business and product requirements into scalable machine learning solutions
Identify high-impact opportunities for applying Generative AI, from ideation to production
Perform in-depth data analysis (EDA), feature engineering, and model evaluation
Design and implement machine learning models, including both traditional ML and deep learning approaches
Run structured experiments to compare model architectures and optimize performance
Deploy models into production environments and maintain continuous improvement loops




Required Qualifications

Strong theoretical understanding and practical experience with machine learning algorithms
Proven track record of deploying machine learning models into production
Hands-on experience with Generative AI frameworks (e.g., LLMs, transformers, diffusion models)
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with object-oriented programming
Solid MLOps experience, including model monitoring and CI/CD pipelines




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with GenAI application development (e.g., conversational agents, content generation, personalization)
Exposure to Big Data tools such as Spark or PySpark
Familiarity with cloud platforms, ideally Azure and Databricks
Industry experience in domains such as fraud detection, recommendation systems, CRM, or sports tech




sam.house@signify-technology.com

Title: Data Science Lead
HTML:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer

  • A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
  • Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
  • Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
  • Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
  • Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
  • Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.


What you will do

  • Manage client interactions and play a key role in building and maintaining client relationships;
  • Apply knowledge of data science concepts to translate business problems to analytics solutions with clear output and with foreseen impactful outcomes;
  • Provide project management oversight required to meet client expectations;
  • Responsibilities may include the development of presentations and managing of external relationships;
  • Seek compelling opportunities beyond the scope of the current project;
  • Provide guidance to more junior members of the team, while orchestrating the work of the entire team.


What you will bring

  • Master (or Ph.D.) degree in a quantitative field with a focus on data analysis (e.g. econometrics, AI, mathematics, physics, and other exact sciences);
  • Sharp thinking ability to be able to quickly differentiate major contributors from irrelevant details and to hierarchically structure information residing in the data under analysis;
  • Robust knowledge of statistical concepts, accompanied by expertise with a set of analytical tools ranging from databases (e.g. SQL, BigQuery, noSQL) to programming languages (e.g. R, Python), and from data visualization (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI) to machine learning.
  • Understanding data engineering solutions is a plus;
  • Proven ability to manage projects with expert team members and to provide inspiring guidance to juniors in the team;
  • 5+ years of consulting experience or relevant industry experience, with at least 1+ years at a project lead level;
  • Excellent communication skills, especially to explain complex analytical concepts in non-technical terms to business users;
  • Professional fluency in English.


In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
Our client combines a passion for football with the power of data and is recruiting a Computer Vision Engineer. This person will be responsible for developing, optimizing, and deploying multi-object tracking pipelines to analyze football matches. Your work will have a direct impact on player tracking, tactical insights, and scouting solutions.

Responsabilities:


Computer Vision & Deep Learning: Develop and refine multi-object tracking models to detect and track players & the ball in football matches
Model Training & Optimization: Train and fine-tune deep learning models cost-effective and high-accuracy tracking
MLOps & Deployment: Deploy and maintain computer vision models in a cloud environment (Azure, Databricks, MLFlow)
Research & Innovation: Stay up to date with the latest advancements in deep learning, object detection, and tracking
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and football experts to integrate tracking solutions into our products


Requirements


3+ years of experience in Computer Vision, Deep Learning, or a related field
Strong knowledge of multi-object tracking, object detection, and image processing
Proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or OpenCV
Experience working with Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs), and Transformer-based vision models
Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Hands-on, pragmatic problem-solving approach with a focus on real-world applications
Excellent English verbal and writing skills (C1-level)
Show more

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Python Developer to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

You Must Have

  • More than 6 years working with Python;
  • Strong SQL skills with experience in database management;
  • Basic knowledge of the Linux command line;
  • Knowledge and practice of DevOps (bitbucket, Jenkins, Sonar, XLDeploy);
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail;
  • Understanding of software engineering principles, design patterns, and best practices;
  • Excellent communication skills;
  • Excellent problem-solving skills;
  • Fluent in English (B2);
  • Knowledge of French is highly valued (but‚ÄØnot‚ÄØmandatory).

What can you expect from us?

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Robotics R&D Engineer
Description:
SARKKIS Robotics is a robotics company, integrated in the AGT Robotics Group (Canada). Our mission is the development of the most advanced welding robotic systems in the world, through the combination of robotics, machine vision, advanced path planning and artificial intelligence.

SARKKIS Robotics headquarters are in Porto University District, with the R&D industrial laboratory located in Santa Maria da Feira.




Role Description

This is a full-time role integrated on the development of AGT labs team that is responsible for the development of the future products of the company. As an R&D Engineer you might deal with a wide variety of technologies, including industrial robotics, mobile robotics, automatic path planning, artificial intelligence and machine vision. If you're someone who thrives in a fast-paced multidisciplinary environment and wants to see intelligent software driving large industrial robotics systems this is a position for you.




Qualifications

Master degree in Electrotechnical Engineering, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Mechanical Engineering (Automation) or a related fields
Good understanding of robotics and automation systems.




Offer:




A permanent employment contract
Flexible working hours
Training
Health insurance,

Title: Senior Data Scientist
HTML:
The Tribe

'Prozis is a powerhouse product developing company. Every day we make new products. That is only possible because we developed our own proprietary technology that ensures that we bring you high quality, beautiful and fair priced products. We endure in our philosophy of a 4.0 vertical process, manufacturing in our own facilities or with the help of our superpartners. We do everything: idea, concept, design, manufacturing, quality control, marketing, sales, logistics, printing, distribution, client support, software development, photo, video, 3D and philosophy. We deliver wherever you are, whenever you want. We don‚Äôt compromise. We breathe technology, drink design and feed on our will to exceed ourselves making the best products in the world. This all starts in 2007 with a crazy guy in a garage that thinks he can change the world for the better. Right now, we are hundreds, going to thousands of crazy but focused people. Will is a skill. There is a lot of people that want to buy us out. We don‚Äôt have a F****** price tag. It‚Äôs not about the money. It‚Äôs about our mission. Trust us. We will feed your body and mind with everything you need to exceed yourself.'

- miguel milh√£o


The Team

Prozis is growing and Data is flying everywhere, do you think you can catch it? Prozis Data Analytics Team collaborates with multiple business stakeholders, including C-level, and has a value-driven proposition in the company.


The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be working in a multitalented team and your role will be analyzing large amounts of data, diving deep to identify business insights and opportunities, design simulations and experiments, developing statistical and ML models by tailoring to business needs, and collaborating with other Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Business Intelligence Engineers and Data Engineers.

You will be responsible for the following topics:

  • Explore, clean, manipulate and analyze valuable data from different data sources with SQL, Python, Scala or equivalent;
  • Translate product objectives to data science problems and vice-versa;
  • Proactively perform data exploration to uncover future opportunities;
  • Work with large and complex datasets, applying statistical analysis, data mining, and machine learning techniques to solve e-commerce business challenges;
  • Develop and deploy predictive models for customer segmentation, demand forecasting, product recommendation, and customer lifetime value (LTV) measurement;
  • Build and maintain data pipelines and interactive dashboards to monitor KPIs and support decision-making processes;
  • Conduct exploratory analyses to identify patterns, trends, and improvement opportunities across the customer journey;
  • Collaborate with Product, Marketing, Operations, and Technology teams to define metrics, test hypotheses, and propose data-driven improvements;
  • Lead experimentation projects (A/B testing), ensuring methodological rigor and extracting actionable business insights;
  • Mentor and support junior data scientists and analysts, fostering technical growth within the team;
  • Clearly communicate analytical results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, translating insights into strategic recommendations.


You

You are an amazing professional, with a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or a related field, experience in a similar role and knowledge of at least some of the following:

  • Solid experience (minimum 4 years) in data science, preferably within e-commerce, retail, or marketplaces;
  • Ability to model analytical and statistical problems as well as different validation techniques;
  • Strong knowledge of SQL;
  • Python (or similar) programming skills using machine learning experimentation and development best practices;
  • Experience with Data Visualization for technical & non-technical audiences;
  • Knowledge of Big Data and Cloud technologies is a plus (PySpark, Spark, Hive, Azure, Databricks).


Nice to Have

  • Experience with NLP (Natural Language Processing) techniques;
  • Background in product recommendation systems, dynamic pricing, or optimization of digital marketing campaigns.


What are your superpowers?

  • Strong technical and analytical skills in the realm of Data;
  • Proactivity and autonomy;
  • Good collaboration and communication skills;
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.

Title: Python Developer for Analytics ‚Äì All Genders - Fluent in English - Porto ‚Äì Permanent Contract ‚Äì Hybrid
Description:
Python Developer ‚Äì Fluent in English ‚Äì All Genders ‚Äì Porto ‚Äì Permanent Contract ‚Äì Hybrid

Join us at BNP Paribas Cardif, the Insurer for a Changing World.

At BNP Paribas Cardif, we're not just an insurance provider; we're pioneers shaping the future of the industry. As the global leader in the insurance market, with a significant presence in savings and protection insurance across 30+ countries all over the globe, we're committed to innovation and excellence.

At our European Service Center - Cardif Support, based in both Porto and Lisbon, Portugal, we're a vibrant hub of over 600 multicultural professionals speaking more than 11 languages!

Our goal? To deliver the highest level of service, reliability, and efficiency to our clients, both internal and external, by offering diverse processes and services aligned with the insurance industry's best practices.

Ready to kick off your next professional chapter with us?

Become our new Python Developer for Finance Analytics based in Porto

Be part of our dynamic ‚ÄúDonn√©es FAR‚Äù (Finance, Actuary, and Risk Data) Department, who is in charge of providing data to 3 main departments of the company : Finance, Actuary and Risk.

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN THE ‚ÄúDONNEES FAR‚Äù TEAM

You will participate in maintenance and development of a key Python-based tool. This tool extracts data from our accounts-management representative reporting, then transforms data to fit our format and needs, check it, and then store it in our database.

Your Key Responsibilities Will Be


Ensure maintenance of the Python-based asset and guarantee that every reporting from out accounts-management representative can be loaded
Participate in the development of new features for the tool
Participate in the development of new template in the tool to extract data from new business or new accounts-management representative
Participate in the development of new reporting in Microsoft PowerBI based on data from the python tool
Be a force of proposal in the optimization of the Python tool and technical framework


READY TO MAKE AN IMPACT? HERE‚ÄôS WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR:


Degree in Data Analysis, Data Engineering or any Python related fields
Minimum of 2-5 years of experience in data analytics or as a Python Developer.
Python full stack development experience, using libraries such as Pandas and Tkinter
Knowledge of finance or accounting data and/or concepts would be beneficial
Experience with PowerBI and SQL would be highly valued
Fluent in English with fluency in French being a big plus


WHAT‚ÄôS IN IT FOR YOU?

In addition to our attractive salary, here‚Äôs a glimpse of what you can expect from us:


Generous Perks: Enjoy meal, child and monthly flexible benefits allowances as part of our comprehensive benefits package.
Comprehensive Coverage: Rest easy with our top-notch insurance package (health, life, and travel), applicable to your spouse and descendants.
Flexibility Redefined: Embrace our hybrid working model for a perfect balance of commitment and personal flexibility.
Endless and tailored Professional Growth: Fuel your career aspirations with continuous development opportunities on both local and global scales
Vibrant Work Environment: Immerse yourself in our modern amenities, including zen rooms, free language courses, and diverse company events.
Culture of Care: Be part of a multicultural environment that prioritizes employee wellbeing and professional growth.


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION ARE IMPORTANT TO US!

BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

CAN WE COUNT ON YOU?

If you're ready to shape the future of insurance and your profile aligns with our vision, send us your application with CV, cover letter, and Certificate of Studies. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

Note: Only complete applications with all the required documentation will be considered.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Description

The role

Our client is an integrated, fully customisable platform that enables organisations to manage their freelance talent effectively and insightfully. Centralising freelancer availability in real-time, empowering hiring managers to onboard, book and pay talent with ease while ensuring compliance with local tax and labour laws.




Get the chance to work with broadcasters across the UK and help our client manage over 1000 bookings each month. The mission is to simplify freelancer management for every stakeholder.




About the Role

Work on a modern, scalable platform that handles booking management, client relationships, and analytics for freelance operations. As a Python Backend Developer on our AI-first development team, you'll architect scalable REST APIs and design complex database schemas that power our core platform. Our team leverages AI tools extensively for accelerated development, debugging, and optimisation.




How will you make an impact

Architect Scalable Solutions: Design and implement secure, efficient cloud solutions using Azure services to optimise infrastructure while enabling cloud-native app environments.
Drive Operational Excellence: Promote system reliability through continuous improvement with advanced observability and streamline CI/CD pipelines to accelerate delivery.
Collaborate to Innovate: Work within cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into cloud-first solutions that drive customer success.

What‚Äôs important to us

Strong background in software development, with solid understanding of various development tools and methodologies.
Experience with Azure services, including IaaS, networking, security, container orchestration (AKS), and serverless computing.
Azure certifications and familiarity with the Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) are a plus.
Experience with automation technologies, such as IaC (e.g., Terraform) and CI/CD pipelines, with a good understanding of software engineering concepts and practices.
Curiosity to learn new technologies, passion for sharing knowledge, and a collaborative approach to problem-solving.







******Please only apply to this role if you are based in Ukraine******

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business.

The Customer AI & Rapid Prototyping department stands at the forefront of digital transformation at TUI, driving company-wide AI adoption. Our team develops innovative AI solutions and personalized customer experiences that create measurable business value and give TUI a competitive edge in the travel industry. We combine data science, AI prototyping, and strategic implementation to deliver both rapid innovation and sustainable personalization solutions. In our dynamic work environment, we foster a culture of experimentation and data-driven decision-making, while working closely with various business units to shape the future of personalized travel experiences.

We're looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our team and create innovative algorithms that solve real business challenges, drive smart decisions, and deliver meaningful impact for our customers.

Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!

About Our Offer


Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.



About The Job


As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be working with your fellow team members to create and provide sophisticated solutions across the whole TUI Group. Working on different business objectives and problems will require your excellent understanding of the context and challenges. As an experienced partner you will combine your excellent technical skills and widespread business understanding to maximise the value that your work delivers.
You are accustomed to work with stakeholder both technical and non-technical, junior and senior and tailor your communication to meet their demand and expectation. You break down complexity to a relatable level and communicate key points, where necessary making use of effective data visualisations. You manage your own projects in an agile manner, help more junior colleagues to break down their tasks, in order to meet deadlines and maximise value.
You will work in a fast-paced team of experts with a passion for AI technology. It works across the whole TUI Group with the mission to find new ways of bringing value to our customers, stay ahead of the evolving customer demand and solve yet unsolved business challenges. Whilst you are building prototypes to proof the value of a solution with less empathies on production ready design, the projects you will support to accelerate into production will need your expertise in well build solutions.
You like to solve business problems, automate processes, use cloud environments to your advantage and you are not hesitant to gain new technical skills. You will use your widespread understanding of the business to consult on possible solutions including their pros and cons and finding the best split between good enough and too complex. You are experienced in a wide range of different data science methods, including statistical models, machine learning and optimisation algorithms. Working with Data Lakes, Data Warehouses and different data structures is something you are used too, and you can source the required data from different areas.
You will have the opportunity to do research, staying informed on new developments in the area of data science or a specific area applicable to you, evaluation of new options, revisiting productionised solutions to try new ways of improvement and sharing your gained knowledge with your team and the data science community, which you are actively helping to construct and organize.
Security is part of everyone‚Äôs job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.



About You


Degree or equivalent experience in computer science, mathematics, or related analytical field.
Proven experience applying advanced data science methods to real-world business problems.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistical modelling, and data analysis, with proficiency in Python and SQL writing production-quality code.
Hands-on experience with SQL/NoSQL databases and platforms like Snowflake.
Solid understanding of data architectures (e.g., Data Lakes, Data Warehouses) and DevSecOps in cloud environments.
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative, agile development practices.
Skilled in data visualisation and storytelling to communicate insights clearly and effectively.
Customer-focused engineer with a passion for crafting high-quality digital products, continuous improvement, and effective team collaboration.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with an understanding of the social, legal, and ethical impact of AI technologies.



From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.

We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Ops Engineer
Description:
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business.

The Customer AI & Rapid Prototyping department stands at the forefront of digital transformation at TUI, driving company-wide AI adoption. Our team develops innovative AI solutions and personalized customer experiences that create measurable business value and give TUI a competitive edge in the travel industry. We combine data science, AI prototyping, and strategic implementation to deliver both rapid innovation and sustainable personalization solutions. In our dynamic work environment, we foster a culture of experimentation and data-driven decision-making, while working closely with various business units to shape the future of personalized travel experiences.

We are looking for a talented and dedicated Machine Learning Ops Engineer to support and accelerate AI adoption at TUI. You will develop, implement, and maintain machine learning models and algorithms, working closely with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems.

Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!

About Our Offer


Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.



About The Job


As a Machine Learning Ops Engineer, you will be part of a cross-functional team that enables AI engineering skills and capabilities across TUI Group, aligning with TUI‚Äôs AI strategy. Being an AI enthusiast with a strong DevSecOps mindset, you‚Äôll collaborate with your team to deliver solutions that challenge the status quo, taking full responsibility for your AI solutions from design to operation. You diligently care about the quality of your work, including proper documentation and security aspects.
You will contribute to projects that explore new ways of delivering value, solving complex business challenges, and meeting evolving customer needs. You‚Äôll help bring prototypes to life on our platforms and support their transition into production by establishing robust operational guardrails. You will monitor and optimize the performance of deployed AI models and collaborate with engineering colleagues on AI-related tasks to deliver impactful, data-driven solutions.
You can articulate your thoughts and ideas and take the initiative to translate them into outcomes, ensuring alignment with business and technical teams together with the domain‚Äôs teams and the Group Enabler teams, you will research, evaluate, and test new approaches, processes, and tools, helping teams use them effectively. You will participate in Communities of Practice and collaborate on shared initiatives to grow your experience. You are eager to learn and grow in your role, welcoming support and coaching from senior colleagues.
You thrive in an international, multi-cultural team, constructively challenging and holding high expectations for yourself and others. You consistently drive for technical excellence, ownership, and self-organization at both team and personal levels. You are passionate about learning, acquiring new skills, and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in your focus areas.
Security is part of everyone‚Äôs job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.



About You


Experience in productionising and using various AI models and algorithms.
Experience in deploying AI solutions using CI/CD pipelines, API development and containers.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Understanding of machine learning/AI frameworks and libraries.
Hands-on experience with cloud technologies and services (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Experience with monitoring and log collection systems (e.g. DataDog).
Some experience with Generative AI technologies (e.g. Bedrock, Langchain, LangGraph).
Customer-focused engineer with a passion for crafting high-quality digital products, continuous improvement, and effective team collaboration.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with an understanding of the social, legal, and ethical impact of AI technologies.



From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.

We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

Title: Quality Assurance Scientist | Connected Things Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_24) | Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_24

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Salary: The range is between ‚Ç¨1,751.27 and ‚Ç¨1,834.93, depending on the candidate's professional experience (1 year or more).

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOS is seeking a talented Quality Assurance Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Connected Things (Cyber-physical systems) Group, namely in Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs. It is expected that the candidate will contribute to the business area of Digital Health.

Your Role

  • Document and maintain software requirements;
  • Document, execute and maintain test cases based on requirements;
  • Develop and maintain UI tests;
  • Set up and maintain CI/CD pipelines.

Your Profile

  • Mandatory Requirements:

> Academic Qualifications: Master's degree or equivalent academic qualification in Informatics, Bioengineering, and Computing Engineering or similar;

> Professional Experience: Preferably 1 year of professional experience in the field.

  • Technical Skills:

> Candidates should have experience in software engineering and testing. Experience in developing automated tests for mobile or web applications is highly regarded. The candidate will work in close contact with software development, so experience within this field will be highly valued.

  • Other Skills:

> Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);

> Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Experience with test case management tools, such as TestRail or similar;
  • Experience with CI/CD tools, such as Jenkins or similar;
  • Candidates experienced in automating tests of Flutter and/or Java (Spring Boot) applications using mocking tools such as Mockito or similar is highly valued;
  • Experience with Quality Management System maintenance or auditing, according to standards such as ISO 13485:2016 or ISO 9001:2015, is valued.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and hybrid work opportunities, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are open from the 5th to the 20th of August 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working October 1st, 2025.

Applications must be made to the email jobs@fraunhofer.pt and contain:

  • Curriculum Vitae ‚Äì mandatory;
  • Motivation Letter ‚Äì optional;
  • Recommendation Letters ‚Äì optional.

Selection Process

Admitted candidates will be subject to a curricular evaluation. Based on the results, the top-ranked candidates will be invited for an interview. All applicants will be notified of the results of the call via the email address provided in their application.

After notification, all candidates have 10 days to comment.

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • ATE ‚Äì Alian√ßa para a Transi√ß√£o Energ√©tica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. 56 NextGenerationEU (PRR);
  • ConnectedHealth ‚Äì Smart and End-to-end Healthcare Management Platform, with Notice No. 26/SI/2016 and Project Reference No. POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046858;
  • HfPT ‚Äì Health from Portugal, with Notice No. 02/C05-i01/2022 and Project Reference No. 41 NextGenerationEU (PRR);
  • Microelectr√≥nica ‚Äì Agenda Microeletr√≥nica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. 19 NextGenerationEU (PRR);
  • SmILE ‚Äì Smart Implants for Life Enrichment, with Notice No. HORIZON-HLTH-2023-STAYHLTH-01-01 and Project Reference No. 101136376 Horizon Europe Framework Programme.

Title: AI Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
It's more than a job

In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.

‚Äé

We're expanding our global AI Product Group and seeking skilled software engineers to build a service that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) for document data extraction and GenAI-enabled automation. As part of our cross-functional team, you'll focus on developing robust, scalable software architecture while applying your engineering expertise to create innovative AI-powered solutions.

How you create impact


Design and develop scalable, maintainable software components for our document processing and automation platform.
Build reliable APIs and services that integrate with LLMs from Anthropic, Google, and OpenAI.
Implement efficient services within our Kubernetes environment.
Collaborate with product managers and AI specialists to translate requirements into technical solutions.
Write clean, high-quality code with appropriate test coverage.
Contribute to architectural decisions and best practices for the global team.
Participate in code reviews and technical documentation.


What we would like you to bring


3+ years of experience in software engineering with a focus on Python.
Proficient in software design principles and modern development best practices.
Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining services in cloud environments (preferably AWS).
Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience designing and integrating APIs, including REST and GraphQL.
Understanding of distributed systems and scalable architecture patterns.
Exposure to CI/CD workflows, infrastructure as code, and observability tools.
Bonus: Interest or background in data pipelines, document systems, or AI/ML technologies.


What's in it for you

You will have a direct influence on the future of logistics and IT. Your colleagues are experts who shape the IT industry in Portugal and worldwide. We want you to feel comfortable in your working surroundings. Therefore, we are offering you flexible working hours and mobile working arrangements. We value teamwork, continuous learning, and diversity. Kuehne+Nagel offers you a custom-made career ‚Äì through individual planning and supervisors who support and advise you in every way. You get supported by many work-life balance offerings and supplementary health insurance.

Who we are

Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.

As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.

We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

Title: Front End Developer
Description:
OUR HIRING PROCESS:


We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals‚Äîevery person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it‚Äôs decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live.


INFUSE is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy

Innovation is a core value of INFUSE. We are bringing together people, who can look into the future to better understand how technology will shape businesses, people, who create and navigate projects with great potential impact.

We‚Äôre looking for a Front End Developer to join our team and play a key role in:


Evolving a major web platform that will soon scale into multiple regions and languages
Building fast, responsive, and accessible interfaces that support emerging generative AI applications‚Äîincluding intelligent agents, dashboards, and transformative web platforms
Collaborating closely with designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to bring high-impact features to life
Leveraging the latest front-end technologies and frameworks to push performance, usability, and innovation forward


Typical daily tasks and responsibilities:


WordPress websites Frontend development
React/Next.js applications and websites, dashboards, and AI agent interfaces
UI Component Development: Building and maintaining custom React component libraries
Modern Styling Implementation: Working with Tailwind CSS v4 and implementing designs from Figma
Frontend Architecture: Improving and refactoring codebases across different tech stacks
Diverse Project Delivery: Handling everything from planned to urgent React/WordPress projects
Possible website creation in Vercel, Firebase, etc.
Timeline Management: Estimating and delivering frontend tasks across various project types


Requirements:


2+ years of commercial experience with React and Next.js
1+ year of experience with WordPress is a must


Frameworks & Libraries:


React.js (hooks, functional components)
Next.js
State management (e.g. Redux, Zustand or Recoil)


Web Technologies:


JavaScript (ES6+)
TypeScript
HTML5
CSS3 CSS & Styling:
Sass/SCSS
Tailwind CSS v4


API & Communication:


RESTful API
Axios
(Optional) WebSocket / Socket.io for real-time features


Design & UI/UX Tools: Figma

Nice to have (not mandatory) experience with:


PHP
Python
SQL


We offer:


Opportunity to work on great innovative projects;
Professional development;
Competitive compensation in USD;
Professional, friendly, fast-growing team;
Reduced Fridays during summer.


Work schedule - Monday to Friday from 12:00 PM till 8:30 PM EET (Kyiv time).

Title: Senior/Lead Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
It's more than a job

In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.

‚Äé

Join a highly innovative and agile team of data scientists, data engineers, and software developers based in Hamburg, Porto, and Wroc≈Çaw to shape the next generation of data-driven logistics. As a Senior/Lead Data Scientist in the corporate AI team, you will design and implement world-class AI solutions for automation, decision-making, and optimization using the latest technologies. We are looking for a candidate who combines deep expertise in AI and software development with a passion for solving domain-specific challenges.

How you create impact


Design and implement our AI solutions using state-of-the-art AI technologies.
Shape the entire lifecycle of AI applications ‚Äì from ideation and exploration to specification, architectural design, prototyping, production implementation and enterprise-wide integration.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to identify new opportunities.
Mentor more junior team members by sharing technical and domain expertise.
Uphold high engineering standards through code reviews and technical guidance.
Take an active role in project coordination and roadmap planning.


What we would like you to bring


Master‚Äôs or PhD degree in data science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, physics or a related field.
Two years of experience as a Senior Data Scientist or in an equivalent role.
Capability to envision and deliver end-to-end data-driven solutions.
Advanced hands-on experience in AI model development with strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks. Familiarity with large language models (LLMs), retrieval augmented generation (RAG) and agent-based systems is a plus.
Proficiency in Python with proven software architecture and development skills in enterprise environments.
Experience with data pipelines, workflow orchestration, APIs and databases. Practical experience with deployment, CI/CD pipelines and cloud platforms is a plus.
Experience mentoring team members and consulting with business stakeholders.
Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English paired with a collaborative mindset.


What's in it for you

Join Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs IT Hub in Porto or Wroc≈Çaw and make a real impact on the digital transformation of our logistics enterprise. Here, you will find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You‚Äôll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, we encourage you to apply ‚Äî your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

Who we are

Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.

As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.

We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

Title: Full Stack Software Engineer
Description:
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business.

The Customer AI & Rapid Prototyping department stands at the forefront of digital transformation at TUI, driving company-wide AI adoption. Our team develops innovative AI solutions and personalized customer experiences that create measurable business value and give TUI a competitive edge in the travel industry. We combine data science, AI prototyping, and strategic implementation to deliver both rapid innovation and sustainable personalization solutions. In our dynamic work environment, we foster a culture of experimentation and data-driven decision-making, while working closely with various business units to shape the future of personalized travel experiences.

We are looking for a talented and dedicated Full Stack Software Engineer to enable and support the AI acceleration and adoption within TUI.

Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!

About Our Offer


Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.



About The Job


You will be part of a cross-functional team that enables AI engineering skills and capabilities across TUI Group, aligning with TUI‚Äôs AI strategy. Together with your team you will own the software products from conception to operation. Being an enthusiast in software engineering and software craftsmanship, with a strong DevSecOps mindset, and thanks to your excellent collaboration skills you‚Äôll collaborate with your team to deliver solutions that challenge the status quo, taking full responsibility for its applications, from design to operation. With your advanced skillset for understanding and solving problems you are able to take full ownership of complex topics or multi-faceted initiatives and outcomes panning across your TUI.
You will be part of a fast-paced team of experts with a passion for AI technology. It works across the whole TUI Group with the mission to find new ways of bringing value to our customers, stay ahead of the evolving customer demand and solve yet unsolved business challenges. Whilst you work with your team to build prototypes to proof the value of a solution with less empathies on production ready design, the projects you will support to accelerate into production will need your expertise in well build solutions. You are able to select, and guide teams to use the right tools for the right job and thus solve the given business and technical problems in an efficient way.
You will work in a cloud environment, especially AWS, and develop resilient and high-performing cloud-native applications. You have a deep understanding of the AWS toolbox, leveraging AWS services and cloud design patterns in a micro-service and micro-frontend landscape. You tackle the whole cycle of designing, building, testing and deploying software and contribute to increasing automation.
You are able to verbalise your thoughts and ideas and take the initiative to translate ideas into outcomes. Together with your team as well as the Group Enabler teams you also will research, evaluate and test new approaches, processes and tools and help teams to use them effectively. You are well-connected across the domain, within the broader TUI community and relevant Communities of Practice.
You love to work in an international, multi-cultural team. You challenge constructively and have high expectations of yourself and others. You always drive for technical excellence, ownership and self-organisation at team and personal level. You regularly coach, guide and develop more junior colleagues. You love to learn and acquire new skills and keep up to date with latest developments in your focus areas.
Security is part of everyone‚Äôs job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.



About You


Strong expertise in Python as well as its eco-system and tooling.
Excellent knowledge of applying web delivery design principles for websites and web applications for a positive user experience.
Deep experience with implementing resource-oriented APIs (REST, GraphQL) on client and server side.
Experience with data persistence (SQL/noSQL).
Deep expertise in cloud design, infrastructure as code, tools and services on AWS.
Good experience with CI/CD, preferably Gitlab CI.
Ability to design, build, test, and deploy applications.
Customer centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services.
Strong software craftsmanship mindset, with familiarity in TDD and BDD practices.
Passionate about continuous improvement, collaboration, and building strong, high-performing teams.
Skilled in coaching and mentoring others, with a commitment to knowledge sharing and lifelong learning.
Strong communicator and problem-solver, with ethical awareness and the ability to thrive in ambiguity and autonomy.



What will be a plus:


Proven track record in building applications around (Gen)AI.
Experience with Streamlit.
Experience with developing for a containerized ecosystem, especially Docker with Kubernetes.
Experience running data pipelines in AWS or Airflow.
Experience with Terraform and/or CDK/Cloudformation.



From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.

We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

About The Job

  • You will be part of a cross-functional team that enables AI engineering skills and capabilities across TUI Group, aligning with TUI‚Äôs AI strategy. Together with your team you will own the software products from conception to operation. Being an enthusiast in software engineering and software craftsmanship, with a strong DevSecOps mindset, and thanks to your excellent collaboration skills you‚Äôll collaborate with your team to deliver solutions that challenge the status quo, taking full responsibility for its applications, from design to operation. With your advanced skillset for understanding and solving problems you are able to take full ownership of complex topics or multi-faceted initiatives and outcomes panning across your TUI.
  • You will be part of a fast-paced team of experts with a passion for AI technology. It works across the whole TUI Group with the mission to find new ways of bringing value to our customers, stay ahead of the evolving customer demand and solve yet unsolved business challenges. Whilst you work with your team to build prototypes to proof the value of a solution with less empathies on production ready design, the projects you will support to accelerate into production will need your expertise in well build solutions. You are able to select, and guide teams to use the right tools for the right job and thus solve the given business and technical problems in an efficient way.
  • You will work in a cloud environment, especially AWS, and develop resilient and high-performing cloud-native applications. You have a deep understanding of the AWS toolbox, leveraging AWS services and cloud design patterns in a micro-service and micro-frontend landscape. You tackle the whole cycle of designing, building, testing and deploying software and contribute to increasing automation.
  • You are able to verbalise your thoughts and ideas and take the initiative to translate ideas into outcomes. Together with your team as well as the Group Enabler teams you also will research, evaluate and test new approaches, processes and tools and help teams to use them effectively. You are well-connected across the domain, within the broader TUI community and relevant Communities of Practice.
  • You love to work in an international, multi-cultural team. You challenge constructively and have high expectations of yourself and others. You always drive for technical excellence, ownership and self-organisation at team and personal level. You regularly coach, guide and develop more junior colleagues. You love to learn and acquire new skills and keep up to date with latest developments in your focus areas.
  • Security is part of everyone‚Äôs job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.


About You

  • Strong expertise in Python as well as its eco-system and tooling.
  • Excellent knowledge of applying web delivery design principles for websites and web applications for a positive user experience.
  • Deep experience with implementing resource-oriented APIs (REST, GraphQL) on client and server side.
  • Experience with data persistence (SQL/noSQL).
  • Deep expertise in cloud design, infrastructure as code, tools and services on AWS.
  • Good experience with CI/CD, preferably Gitlab CI.
  • Ability to design, build, test, and deploy applications.
  • Customer centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services.
  • Strong software craftsmanship mindset, with familiarity in TDD and BDD practices.
  • Passionate about continuous improvement, collaboration, and building strong, high-performing teams.
  • Skilled in coaching and mentoring others, with a commitment to knowledge sharing and lifelong learning.
  • Strong communicator and problem-solver, with ethical awareness and the ability to thrive in ambiguity and autonomy.


What will be a plus:

  • Proven track record in building applications around (Gen)AI.
  • Experience with Streamlit.
  • Experience with developing for a containerized ecosystem, especially Docker with Kubernetes.
  • Experience running data pipelines in AWS or Airflow.
  • Experience with Terraform and/or CDK/Cloudformation.


From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.

We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

Title: Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, Workflows, AI/ML & Analytics
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring Python and Kubernetes Specialist Engineers focused on Data, Workflows, AI/ML and Analytics Solutions to join our teams building open source solutions for public cloud and private infrastructure.

As a software engineer on the team, you'll collaborate on end-to-end data analytics and MLOps solutions composed of popular, open-source, machine learning tools, such as Kubeflow, MLFlow, DVC, and Feast. You may also work on ETL, data governance and visualization tools like Apache SuperSet, dbt, workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow and Temporal, or data warehouse solutions such as Apache Trino, or ClickHouse. These solutions may be run on servers or on the cloud, on machines or on Kubernetes, on developer desktops, or as web services.

We serve the needs of individuals and community members as much as the needs of our Global 2000 and Fortune 500 customers; we make our primary work available free of charge and our Pro subscriptions are also available to individuals for personal use at no cost. Our goal is to enable more people to enjoy the benefits of open source, regardless of their circumstances.

Location: This initiative spans many teams that are home-based and in multiple time zones. We believe in distributed collaboration but we also try to ensure that colleagues have company during their work hours! Successful candidates will join a team where most members and your manager are broadly in the same time zone so that you have the benefits of constant collaboration and discussion.

What your day will look like


Develop your understanding of the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, and storage, to the application layer
Design, build and maintain solutions that will be deployed on public and private clouds and local workstations
Master distributed systems concepts such as observability, identity, tracing
Work with both Kubernetes and machine-oriented open source applications
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team of engineers, designers and product managers
Debug issues and interact in public with upstream and Ubuntu communities
Generate and discuss ideas, and collaborate on finding good solutions


What we are looking for in you


Professional or academic software delivery using Python
Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


Additional skills that would be nice to have

The following skills may be helpful to you in the role, but we don't expect everyone to bring all of them.


Proven track record of building highly automated machine learning solutions, data pipelines, or orchestrating workflows for the cloud.
Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries, or tools.
Experience with container technologies (Docker, LXD, Kubernetes, etc.)
Experience with public clouds (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Working knowledge of cloud computing
Passionate about software quality and testing
Experience working on an open source project


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Retail & Ecommerce | Fullstack React & Python
HTML:
Company Description
At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description
  • Design, develop, and implement fullstack web applications using React for frontend and Python for backend development;
  • Create responsive and user-friendly interfaces for our ecommerce platform;
  • Develop and integrate RESTful APIs to connect frontend and backend systems;
  • Optimize application performance and scalability to handle high traffic volumes;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions;
  • Implement security best practices to protect sensitive customer and transaction data;
  • Participate in code reviews and contribute to continuous improvement of development processes;
  • Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in retail and ecommerce;
  • Troubleshoot and debug issues in both frontend and backend systems;
  • Contribute to the maintenance and enhancement of existing applications.


Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (preferred)
  • Proven experience in fullstack development, with a strong focus on React and Python
  • Proficiency in frontend technologies including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Solid understanding of backend development principles and experience with Python frameworks (e.g., Django)
  • Experience working with RESTful APIs and integrating third-party services.
  • Strong knowledge of database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
  • Familiarity with version control systems, preferably Git.
  • Experience with Haystack.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent organizational and time management abilities
  • Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
  • Understanding of retail and ecommerce industry trends and challenges
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Additional Information
Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Software Developer
HTML:
Who is Volkswagen Financial Services?

It's been more than 70 years since Volkswagen Financial Services AG financed the first Volkswagen vehicles in Germany in 1949. A lot has changed since then, but our core goal hasn't; ensuring we meet the mobility needs of the people.

Volkswagen Financial Services today operates in 48 markets through its various subsidiaries, shareholdings, and joint ventures. Volkswagen Financial Services is the largest provider of automotive financial services worldwide.


What do we do?

The Volkswagen Financial Services Porto is a VWFS AG IT hub, and the first outside Germany. Here we will establish a long-term Business & IT company of 120+ FTE. Our primary goal is to service all European markets in implementing and maintaining contract management systems. Our focus is on: Core systems, satellite systems (such as document management systems, collection systems) but also extends to integrations, data, and large project organizations. For this we seek a hands-on Solution Architect.


Objectives:

In this role, you‚Äôll be diving into the development and enhancement of solutions using OpenText‚Ñ¢ tools like Service Management (SMAX), Service Manager 9.7.1, and Operations Orchestration (OO). You don‚Äôt need to be an expert in all of them, but you should bring solid experience in at least one. You‚Äôll also get to work with Apex and AWS, contributing to agile teams that value collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement. Your work will help shape reliable, scalable systems that support IT service management across the organization. If you enjoy solving complex problems, working with modern tools, and being part of a team that drives meaningful change, this could be a great fit for you.



In this role, you will be responsible for:


  • Develop and maintain solutions using OpenText‚Ñ¢ SMAX, Service Manager 9.7.1, and Operations Orchestration (OO);
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement features and enhancements in Apex and AWS environments;
  • Coordinate and manage resolution of technical findings, patches, updates, and certificate renewals;
  • Participate in agile ceremonies (daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives) and contribute to iterative development cycles;
  • Analyse business and technical requirements to design scalable and maintainable solutions;
  • Support integration of OpenText‚Ñ¢ tools with other enterprise systems and platforms;
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues across development and production environments;
  • Document technical specifications, configurations, and development processes;
  • Contribute to company infrastructure and security assessments, including operational tasks automation;
  • Ensure compliance with internal development standards, security policies, and architectural guidelines;
  • Work in sync with product manager and release manager;
  • Creating, adjusting, and updating the associated documents based on the changes made according to the client's specifications;
  • Keep the documentation of the application lifecycle up to date;
  • Supporting AMS in transferring development packages.


We believe that the right profile for this job should have / be:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, information technology, engineering, or a related field;
  • Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a developer in at least one of the following areas/products:
  • OpenText‚Ñ¢ SMAX or Service Manager 9.7.1;
  • OpenText‚Ñ¢ Operations Orchestration (OO);
  • Apex development;
  • AWS-based development;
  • Experience working in agile development environments;
  • Strong understanding of IT Service Management (ITSM) principles and tools;
  • Familiarity with scripting, automation, and integration techniques;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities;
  • Team player with a collaborative mindset;
  • Structured, detail-oriented, and proactive working style;
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment;
  • Familiarity with monitoring tools, patch management, and certificate lifecycle;
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken); German is a plus.


What we Offer:

  • Long-term contract;
  • Competitive package including private health insurance, life insurance and meal allowance (pay by meal card);
  • Bonuses and benefits depending on performance;
  • Schooling allowance and pension scheme;
  • Incredible and unique annual company events;
  • Opportunity to work on an international project and be part of multicultural and multidisciplinary team;
  • Solid performance evaluation and career management methodologies;
  • Continuous training ‚Äì technical and behavioral development.
